episodes.title: Episode 1: Onboarding & Baseline Discovery
episodes.summary: This period focused on gathering Rohan's history, conducting initial diagnostics, and establishing his baseline health metrics to create a foundational plan.
frictionPoints: Initial workout plan was difficult to access due to a password requirement.
Member expressed frustration at the perceived slow pace and lack of proactivity during data collection.
Difficulty in obtaining complete medical records from a previous cardiologist in New York.
episodes.outcome: A foundational Health Optimization Plan (v2.0) was created. Key risk areas, particularly an elevated ApoB level (105 mg/dL) and inconsistent sleep patterns, were identified as top priorities.

personaState.before: Proactive and data-driven but feeling his health management was 'very random and uncoordinated'.
personaState.after: Engaged with the service but questioning the value and taking a more directive role in providing feedback.

granularEvents.title: Initial Blood Panel Ordered
granularEvents.description: Dr. Warren ordered a comprehensive diagnostic panel to get a baseline for metabolic, hormonal, and inflammatory health.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'To proceed with a clinical-grade strategy, we must get a full picture. This is non-negotiable to ensure safety and avoid redundant testing.'

granularEvents.title: Whoop Strap Recommended
granularEvents.description: Advik recommended upgrading from the Garmin watch to a Whoop strap for better sleep data.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Advik: 'Your Garmin gives us a blurry photo of your sleep; we need high-definition video. I strongly recommend we upgrade your biotelemetry to a Whoop strap.'

granularEvents.title: Hip Flexor Tightness Identified
granularEvents.description: Rachel identified hip flexor tightness as the cause of back pain during travel.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Rachel: 'Based on your movement patterns, the issue isn't your back itself, but your tight hips from frequent flying. We'll build a targeted mobility routine to address this.'

granularEvents.title: Elevated ApoB Becomes Top Priority
granularEvents.description: Blood results came back showing an elevated ApoB of 105 mg/dL.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'Your fasting glucose is good, but your ApoB is 105 mg/dL. This is elevated and becomes our primary focus for long-term risk reduction.'

episodes.title: Episode 2: First Interventions & System Test
episodes.summary: The team rolled out the first targeted interventions for ApoB and sleep. A sudden illness tested Elyx’s Sick Day Protocol.
frictionPoints: Business travel to Jakarta made adherence to the new nutrition plan difficult.
A scheduling error by Ruby led to a missed appointment invoice, which Elyx had to cover.
episodes.outcome: Illness was managed with proactive protocols. Data showed positive response to diet changes and Zone 2 cardio.

personaState.after: Became more of a 'co-manager', impressed by illness management.

granularEvents.title: ApoB Nutrition Plan Activated
granularEvents.description: Carla designed a nutrition plan focused on reducing saturated fats and increasing soluble fiber.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Carla: 'To target ApoB, we'll focus on monounsaturated fats and specific fibers. I've sent a guide to your cook, Javier.'

granularEvents.title: Zone 2 Cardio Protocol Started
granularEvents.description: Advik created a personalized Zone 2 cardio protocol to improve cardiovascular efficiency.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Advik: 'We're starting with 30-minute Zone 2 sessions, three times a week. Keep your HR strictly within 115-125 bpm.'

granularEvents.title: Viral Infection Detected by Whoop
granularEvents.description: Whoop data showed elevated RHR and respiratory rate, flagging illness early.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Advik: 'Your RHR is elevated by 12bpm and HRV is down 45%. Absolutely no training.'

granularEvents.title: Sick Day Protocol Activated
granularEvents.description: The team rescheduled his board meeting and arranged IV therapy.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'We are initiating the Elyx Sick Day Protocol immediately. You must postpone your board meeting to ensure a faster recovery.'

episodes.title: Episode 3: Proactive Optimization & New Tech
episodes.summary: The focus shifted to deeper personalization with new tech (CGM, structured strength training).
frictionPoints: Rohan struggled to find time for strength training.
First CGM sensor failed, requiring replacement.
episodes.outcome: CGM data led to improved glycemic control. Strength program successfully integrated.

personaState.before: A 'co-manager', seeing the value in reactive support.
personaState.after: Fully bought-in, suggesting experiments and appreciating data-driven insights.

granularEvents.title: Continuous Glucose Monitor (CGM) Introduced
granularEvents.description: Dr. Warren recommended a CGM for real-time nutrition personalization.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'The CGM will give us real-time data on how your body responds to foods. This is the next level of personalization.'

granularEvents.title: Oatmeal vs. Eggs Experiment
granularEvents.description: CGM revealed glucose spike from oatmeal; Carla suggested switching to eggs + avocado.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Carla: 'This is valuable data. Experiment #1: Tomorrow, try eggs + avocado and compare the glucose curves.'

granularEvents.title: Structured Strength Program Begins
granularEvents.description: Rachel introduced a formal strength training program with compound lifts.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Rachel: 'It's time to graduate to a structured strength program. This is the engine for achieving long-term body composition goals.'

granularEvents.title: Quarterly Blood Test Shows Progress
granularEvents.description: ApoB dropped to 90 mg/dL, with improved inflammatory markers.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'Excellent news. Your ApoB is down to 90 mg/dL. The interventions are working.'

episodes.title: Episode 4: Long-Term Goals & Longevity Focus
episodes.summary: Shift from managing risks to building a long-term performance & longevity platform.
frictionPoints: Scheduling full-body MRI and DEXA scans around travel was challenging.
episodes.outcome: A comprehensive longevity plan was created, integrating advanced diagnostics and cognitive goals.

personaState.before: Proactive and engaged with current metrics.
personaState.after: Strategic and future-focused, fully trusting Elyx to manage long-term trajectory.

granularEvents.title: Full-Body MRI Screening Proposed
granularEvents.description: Neel proposed a proactive cancer screening strategy with MRI.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Neel: 'For longevity, we recommend a full-body MRI as a baseline, radiation-free screening tool.'

granularEvents.title: 'Centenarian Decathlon' Goals Set
granularEvents.description: Rachel set long-term goals for strength, VO2 max, and balance.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Rachel: 'I propose these goals for the next 24 months: Deadlift 1.5x BW, VO2 Max top 10%, hold a single-leg stand 30s.'

granularEvents.title: Cognitive Health Goal: Learning Piano
granularEvents.description: Rohan chose piano as a cognitive longevity intervention.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Dr. Warren: 'Learning piano engages multiple domains of the brain. Excellent for cognitive reserve.'

granularEvents.title: 8-Month Review & Future Planning
granularEvents.description: Team reviewed progress and mapped next year’s plan.
granularEvents.sourceCommunication: Neel: 'We've moved from stabilizing risks to building a high-performance platform. Q4 will focus on longevity goals.'
